newsitem.title: UK: NWE oil products stagnate in thin market.
newsitem.headline: NWE oil products stagnate in thin market.

text.p: NWE oil products stagnated in practically non-existent trade on Friday with many players away from the market due to the Christmas break, traders said.
Outright gas oil prices were pulled higher by modest gains in benchmark IPE futures. January gas oil futures were trading $2.50 higher at $218.00 a tonne at 1038 GMT.
A heating oil barge was reported sold at screen flat for December delivery.

Brokers assessed premiums at Jan IPE -50/+50 cents for prompt delivery and Jan IPE flat/$1 for first half January delivery, but some sellers said, given the arctic conditions across much of Europe, they would hold out for higher premiums.
Brokers in the high sulphur fuel oil barge market said they had heard nothing traded so far.
One broker assessed high sulphur fuel oil barge prices at $111-112/$115 a tonne fob ARA but said he was expecting very little action throughout the day.
The gasoline market was similarly dead. No trade and very little talk was heard. The last Eurograde barge deal reported on Tuesday was done at $219 a tonne.
